verses.verse: "Now these are the ordinances <S%H4941><s%> which you shall set <S%H7760><s%> before them. <S%H6440><s%>

"If you buy <S%H7069><s%> a Hebrew <S%H5680><s%> servant, <S%H5650><s%> he shall serve <S%H5647><s%> six <S%H8337><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> and in the seventh <S%H7637><s%> he shall go out <S%H3318><s%> free <S%H2670><s%> without paying anything. <S%H2600><s%>

If he comes in <S%H935><s%> by himself, <S%H1610><s%> he shall go out <S%H3318><s%> by himself. <S%H1610><s%> If he is married, <S%H1167><s%> then his wife <S%H802><s%> shall go out with him. <S%H3318><s%>

If his master <S%H113><s%> gives <S%H5414><s%> him a wife <S%H802><s%> and she bears <S%H3205><s%> him sons <S%H1121><s%> or daughters, <S%H1323><s%> the wife <S%H802><s%> and her children <S%H1121><s%> shall be her master <S%H113><s%>'s, and he shall go out <S%H3318><s%> by himself. <S%H1610><s%>

But if the servant <S%H5650><s%> shall plainly <S%H559><s%> say, <S%H559><s%> <S%H157><s%> 'I love my master, <S%H113><s%> my wife, <S%H802><s%> and my children. <S%H1121><s%> I will not go out <S%H3318><s%> free; <S%H2670><s%>'

then his master <S%H113><s%> shall bring <S%H5066><s%> him to God, <S%H430><s%> and shall bring <S%H5066><s%> him to the door <S%H1817><s%> or to the doorpost, <S%H4201><s%> and his master <S%H113><s%> shall bore <S%H7527><s%> his ear <S%H241><s%> through with an awl, <S%H4836><s%> and he shall serve <S%H5647><s%> him for ever. <S%H5769><s%>
"If a man <S%H376><s%> sells <S%H4376><s%> his daughter <S%H1323><s%> to be a female servant, <S%H519><s%> she shall not go out <S%H3318><s%> as the male servants <S%H5650><s%> do. <S%H3318><s%>

If she doesn't <S%H7451><s%> please her master, <S%H113><s%> who has married <S%H3259><s%> her to himself, <S%H6299><s%> then he shall let her be redeemed. He shall have no right <S%H4910><s%> to sell <S%H4376><s%> her to a foreign <S%H5237><s%> people, <S%H5971><s%> since he has dealt deceitfully with her. <S%H898><s%>
If he marries <S%H3259><s%> her to his son, <S%H1121><s%> he shall deal <S%H6213><s%> with her as <S%H4941><s%> a daughter. <S%H1323><s%>
If he takes <S%H3947><s%> another <S%H312><s%> wife to himself, <S%H1639><s%> he shall not diminish her food, <S%H7607><s%> her clothing, <S%H3682><s%> and her marital rights. <S%H5772><s%>
If he doesn't <S%H6213><s%> do these three <S%H7969><s%> things for her, <S%H3318><s%> she may go free <S%H2600><s%> without paying any money. <S%H3701><s%>
"One who strikes <S%H5221><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> so that he dies <S%H4191><s%> shall surely <S%H4191><s%> be put to death, <S%H4191><s%>

but not if it is unintentional, <S%H6658><s%> but God <S%H430><s%> allows <S%H579><s%> it to happen: <S%H3027><s%> then I will appoint <S%H7760><s%> you a place <S%H4725><s%> where he shall flee. <S%H5127><s%>

If a man <S%H376><s%> schemes <S%H6195><s%> and comes presumptuously <S%H2102><s%> on his neighbor <S%H7453><s%> to kill <S%H2026><s%> him, <S%H3947><s%> you shall take him from my altar, <S%H4196><s%> that he may die. <S%H4191><s%>
"Anyone who attacks <S%H5221><s%> his father <S%H1><s%> or his mother <S%H517><s%> shall be surely <S%H4191><s%> put to death. <S%H4191><s%>

"Anyone who kidnaps <S%H1589><s%> someone <S%H376><s%> and sells <S%H4376><s%> him, <S%H4672><s%> or if he is found in his hand, <S%H3027><s%> he shall surely <S%H4191><s%> be put to death. <S%H4191><s%>
"Anyone who curses <S%H7043><s%> his father <S%H1><s%> or his mother <S%H517><s%> shall surely <S%H4191><s%> be put to death. <S%H4191><s%>

"If men <S%H582><s%> quarrel <S%H7378><s%> and one <S%H376><s%> strikes <S%H5221><s%> the other <S%H7453><s%> with a stone, <S%H68><s%> or <S%H176><s%> with his fist, <S%H106><s%> and he doesn't <S%H4191><s%> die, but is confined <S%H5307><s%> to bed; <S%H4904><s%>

if he rises again <S%H6965><s%> and walks <S%H1980><s%> around with his staff, <S%H4938><s%> then he who struck <S%H5221><s%> him shall be cleared: <S%H5414><s%> only he shall pay for the loss of his time, <S%H7674><s%> and shall provide <S%H5414><s%> for his healing until <S%H7674><s%> he is thoroughly <S%H7495><s%> healed. <S%H7495><s%>

"If a man <S%H376><s%> strikes <S%H5221><s%> his servant <S%H5650><s%> or his maid <S%H519><s%> with a rod, <S%H7626><s%> and he dies <S%H4191><s%> under his hand, <S%H3027><s%> he shall surely <S%H5358><s%> be punished. <S%H5358><s%>
Notwithstanding, <S%H389><s%> if he gets <S%H5975><s%> up after a day <S%H3117><s%> or two, <S%H8147><s%> he shall not be punished, <S%H5358><s%> for he is his property. <S%H3701><s%>

"If men <S%H582><s%> fight <S%H5327><s%> and hurt <S%H5062><s%> a pregnant <S%H2030><s%> woman <S%H802><s%> so that she gives birth <S%H3206><s%> prematurely, <S%H3318><s%> and yet no harm follows, <S%H611><s%> he shall be surely <S%H6064><s%> fined <S%H6064><s%> as much <S%H5414><s%> as the woman <S%H802><s%>'s husband <S%H1167><s%> demands <S%H7896><s%> and the judges allow. <S%H6414><s%>
But if any harm follows, <S%H611><s%> then you must take <S%H5414><s%> life <S%H5315><s%> for life, <S%H5315><s%>
eye <S%H5869><s%> for eye, <S%H5869><s%> tooth <S%H8127><s%> for tooth, <S%H8127><s%> hand <S%H3027><s%> for hand, <S%H3027><s%> foot <S%H7272><s%> for foot, <S%H7272><s%>
burning <S%H3555><s%> for burning, <S%H3555><s%> wound <S%H6482><s%> for wound, <S%H6482><s%> and bruise <S%H2250><s%> for bruise. <S%H2250><s%>

"If a man <S%H376><s%> strikes <S%H5221><s%> his servant <S%H5650><s%>'s eye, <S%H5869><s%> or his maid <S%H519><s%>'s eye, <S%H5869><s%> and destroys <S%H7843><s%> it, <S%H7971><s%> he shall let him go free <S%H2670><s%> for <S%H8478><s%> his eye <S%H5869><s%>'s sake.

If he strikes <S%H5307><s%> out his male servant <S%H5650><s%>'s tooth, <S%H8127><s%> or his female servant <S%H519><s%>'s tooth, <S%H8127><s%> he shall let him go <S%H7971><s%> free <S%H2670><s%> for his tooth <S%H8127><s%>'s sake.

"If a bull <S%H7794><s%> gores <S%H5055><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> or a woman <S%H802><s%> to death, <S%H4191><s%> the bull <S%H7794><s%> shall surely <S%H5619><s%> be stoned, <S%H5619><s%> and its flesh <S%H1320><s%> shall not be eaten; <S%H398><s%> but the owner <S%H1167><s%> of the bull <S%H7794><s%> shall not be held responsible. <S%H5355><s%>

But if the bull <S%H7794><s%> had a habit of goring <S%H5056><s%> in the past, <S%H8543><s%> and it has been testified <S%H5749><s%> to its owner, <S%H1167><s%> and he has not kept <S%H8104><s%> it in, <S%H4191><s%> but it has killed a man <S%H376><s%> or a woman, <S%H802><s%> the bull <S%H7794><s%> shall be stoned, <S%H5619><s%> and its owner <S%H1167><s%> shall also be put to death. <S%H4191><s%>
If a ransom <S%H3724><s%> is laid <S%H7896><s%> on him, <S%H5414><s%> then he shall give for the redemption <S%H6306><s%> of his life <S%H5315><s%> whatever is laid on him. <S%H7896><s%>

Whether it has gored <S%H5055><s%> a son <S%H1121><s%> or <S%H176><s%> has gored <S%H5055><s%> a daughter, <S%H1323><s%> according to this judgment <S%H4941><s%> it shall be done to him. <S%H6213><s%>

If the bull <S%H7794><s%> gores <S%H5055><s%> a male servant <S%H5650><s%> or a female servant, <S%H519><s%> thirty <S%H7970><s%> shekels <S%H8255><s%> of silver <S%H3701><s%> shall be given <S%H5414><s%> to their master, <S%H113><s%> and the ox <S%H7794><s%> shall be stoned. <S%H5619><s%>

"If a man <S%H376><s%> opens <S%H6605><s%> a pit, <S%H953><s%> or if a man <S%H376><s%> digs <S%H3738><s%> a pit <S%H953><s%> and doesn't <S%H3680><s%> cover it, <S%H7794><s%> and a bull or a donkey <S%H2543><s%> falls into it, <S%H5307><s%>

the owner <S%H1167><s%> of the pit <S%H953><s%> shall make it good. <S%H7999><s%> He shall give <S%H7725><s%> money <S%H3701><s%> to its owner, <S%H1167><s%> and the dead animal shall be his. <S%H4191><s%>

"If one man <S%H376><s%>'s bull <S%H7794><s%> injures <S%H5062><s%> another <S%H7453><s%>'s, so that it dies, <S%H4191><s%> then they shall sell <S%H4376><s%> the live <S%H2416><s%> bull, <S%H7794><s%> and divide <S%H2673><s%> its price; <S%H3701><s%> and they shall also divide <S%H2673><s%> the dead animal. <S%H4191><s%>
